intro: Halliophytum fasciculatum, commonly known as the clustered moss plant, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form, with small, oval-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a compact rosette. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky crevices or on the forest floor in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, erect stems and release spores when mature. Halliophytum fasciculatum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
